TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract OlkFrameHeader implements class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook._OlkFrameHeader, class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Outlook.OlkFrameHeaderEvents_Event

summary.span: 在窗体的各个节之间提供分隔符的控件。

span.span: A control that provides a separator between sections in a form.

para.span: 这是.NET 接口派生的互操作性与相应的 COM 对象的托管代码需要 COM coclass。

span.span: This is a .NET interface derived from a COM coclass that is required by managed code for interoperability with the corresponding COM object.

para.span: 使用此派生的接口访问 COM 对象的所有方法、 属性和事件的成员。

span.span: Use this derived interface to access all method, property, and event members of the COM object.

para.span: 但是，如果方法或想要使用的事件共享相同的名称相同的 COM 对象下，强制转换为相应的主接口调用方法，并强制转换为最新的事件接口，连接到该事件。

span.span: However, if a method or event you want to use shares the same name under the same COM object, cast to the corresponding primary interface to call the method, and cast to the latest events interface to connect to the event.

para.span: 请参阅本主题的 COM 对象有关的信息。

span.span: Refer to this topic for information about the COM object.

para.span: 有关 COM 对象的方法和属性成员的信息，请参阅。

span.span: For information about the method and property members of the COM object, see .

para.span: 此控件用于在窗体设计器中的第一个时间之前，将添加到控件工具箱的 Microsoft Office Outlook 框架头控件。

span.span: Before you use this control for the first time in the forms designer, add the Microsoft Office Outlook Frame Header Control to the control toolbox.

para.span: 仅可以将此控件添加到 Outlook 窗体使用窗体设计器; 在窗体区域您不能将此控件添加到 Visual Basic UserForm对象在 Visual Basic 编辑器中。

span.span: You can only add this control to a form region in an Outlook form using the forms designer; you cannot add this control to a Visual Basic UserForm object in the Visual Basic Editor.

para.span: 下面是运行时框架标题控件的一个示例。此控件支持 Microsoft Windows 主题。

span.span: The following is an example of a frame header control at runtime. This control supports Microsoft Windows themes.

para.span: 有关 Outlook 控件的详细信息，请参阅自定义窗体中的控件

span.span: For more information about Outlook controls, see Controls in a Custom Form
